rComments: Of all the Writing 2 teachers, Farquhar is definitely among one of the easiest. She mostly cares about improvement in your writing as a whole. Her grades are based on your improvement as a writer and your participation in class discussions. Had 4 essays & 1 research paper. The essays were technically rough drafts, she made re-writes extra credit.

Dion is an amazing person, very interesting to get to know. She has a lot of big ideas that will get you thinking. I'm pretty sure she is queer, which is awesome; she will make you feel welcome no matter your background or identity. She likes elaboration in essays, which can be difficult to do without writing too much or getting off topic.

Took her for crown 79 and she was one of the nicest profs. The lectures were alright if you're into philosophy and Frankenstein, and the writing assignments were short. But she doesn't gives you any feedback on the writing and makes you peer grade. Luckily she didn't assign much reading. Just show up to class and raise your hand!

Oh Dion. I'm not sure if it was you or the course criteria, but assigning 1 page maximum essays with no feedback whatsoever actually made my writing worse than it was before I took the class. I was actually marked down for writing over a page, and everyone had to use the god awful peerceptiv system to upload assignments.

Probably the easiest of the Crown 80A teachers. She's pretty nice and lenient with due dates. She relates almost every reading to gender/gender inequality.  Some students don't respect her, but they are the ones who don't pay attention during discussion and don't read assigned readings. Do all the work and you'll have a guaranteed B or higher.

She was a great professor. Engaging but can go on tangents often. Overall, the class was pretty easy (probably one of the easiest Writing 2 classes). As long as you participated and improved then you did well. She was EXTREMELY nice and truly cared about progress. I highly recommend her class.

ALL READINGS ARE ONLINE! She expects students to have them in class, printed or on phone. She's very reasonable and upbeat, which made the class bearable at 8AM. I found the content somewhat repetitive eeven though she tried to vary the readings a bit. Compared to other core teachers, she spaced out our five essays equally throughout the quarter.

Dion broadened my perspective with Sci Fi Lit. She had a good mix of lecturing and group discussion. We were all enthusiastic about the readings. I didn't mind the writing requirements. Our focus was on race, gender, and class, which I at first pooh-poohed as being typical Santa Cruz liberalism, but in the context of sci-fi it was interesting.
She really cares. Not a hard class. Real devolution.

Super easy class. Grade base on progress. Fun enjoyable teacher that really cares. All she want is for you to talk in class and try your best on your essays. There is a good amount of reading from the Reader. PARTICIPATE AND TALK IN CLASS!!!! Also offers extra credit.
Wow. Easiest writing class out of this year Crown80A classes. She is so helpful and insightful too. She cut back on readings and writings starting this year. Take her class to get an easy time.

didn't mention ribs at all, must just be that weird Stevenson college thing. A Very interesting, quirky and quite bizarre teacher that brings out the oddness of the class. Generally she can get off topic pretty easily but that only made the class more interesting. She is an easy grader and usually causes our class to go into a commotion.

Dean totally did the rib thing!!! She was boring and didnt provide much of a compelling discussion forum. The funniest thing about her is that she apparently wrote an erotica novel... i hope it was about the rib. I cant believe she got paid to be at UCSC.
Smart woman, interesting insights on material (the rib pretty hard grader, not particularly great at facilitating discussion or getting people interested. Treats students a little condescendingly.

Yes to the comment on that fallic rib thing!  She managed to draw similar themes throughout the course, and it got a little old.  A nice woman, but wasn't able to draw out much participation.  We did a lot of just sitting there.
a little too much of a femanist when you suggest that the rib which God made Eve from is a phallic object.
